event.description: {CovLStr{v1}{{0} is always {1} regardless of the values of its operands.}{(tmp >> 3) & -32 /* ~0x1f */}{0}}{CovLStr{v1}{This occurs as the logical operand of '!'.}}{CovLStr{v1}{Did you intend to apply '{0}' to {1} and {2}?}{&}{3}{-32 /* ~0x1f */}}{CovLStr{v1}{If so, parentheses would be required to force this interpretation.}}
{CovLStr{v1}{{0} is always false regardless of the values of its operands.}{box->len >= (4294967296ULL /* (uint_fast64_t)1 << 32 */)}}{CovLStr{v1}{This occurs as a value.}}
